thread.title: Hillgrove rolls up 551 yards of offense in rout of North Paulding
thread.title_full: Hillgrove rolls up 551 yards of offense in rout of North Paulding

author: E. Marcel Pourtout MDJ Sports Writer (noreply@mdjonline.com)
title: Hillgrove rolls up 551 yards of offense in rout of North Paulding
text: Hillgrove rolls up 551 yards of offense in rout of North Paulding by E. Marcel Pourtout October 10, 2015 02:19 AM | 52 views | 0 | 0 | | Hillgrove’s Tavion Walker runs past the North Paulding defense on Friday. Walker scored a second-quarter touchdown that helped the Hawks take control of the game. Hillgrove beat North Paulding 55-35. slideshow POWDER SPRINGS — In a game that saw 1,014 yards of total offense, Hillgrove defeated North Paulding 55-35 on Friday.The Hawks (4-3, 2-1) threw for 337 yards, led by a team-high 263 yards and three touchdowns from Hunter Arters. “There have been some issues there, but we have unselfish kids who are willing to do anything and were vital parts of our success,” Hillgrove coach Phillip Ironside said about his quarterback situation.Hillgrove also ran for 214 yards. Overall, the Hawks had 551 yards of total offense.“We blocked well up front and were able to do some things on the perimeter,” Ironside said.With the game tied at 14 at the end of the first quarter, the Hawks proceeded to score 21 consecutive points in the second to take control of the game. The first score came on a trick play when Arters pitched the ball to Bryson Parks, who threw down the right sideline to a wide-open Bingo Long for a 29-yard touchdown. Consecutive 1-yard touchdown runs by Tavion Walker and Matthew Wilson pushed Hillgrove’s lead to 35-14.The Wolfpack scored with 9 seconds left in the first half on a 35-yard touchdown pass to D.J. Owens from Kyle Banks, which cut the Hawks’ lead to 35-21 at halftime.Banks threw for a game-high 276 yards while Owens finished with a team-high 86 yards receiving. Overall, North Paulding had 463 yards of total offense.“We felt good about our defense (Friday),” Ironside said. “We gave up some points on special teams and a big play in the first half but held them in check in the second half.”Hillgrove outscored North Paulding 13-0 in the third quarter including a 45-yard touchdown catch by Jeremiah Bridges. He had a game-high 103 yards receiving on five catches with two touchdowns.Trevor Smith had a game-high 68 yards on the ground for the Hawks and added a touchdown in the fourth quarter.The victory keeps Hillgrove in the Region 4 race after dropping its contest to North Cobb last week. “It gives you a chance and some things have to happen,” Ironside said. “We’ve been there before. All we can worry about is Kennesaw Mountain next week and take it one game at a time.” Share This Article | similar stories
